I could use a break with no treatment for a few weeks anyway.

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2011 09:42PM ForMyBoys wrote: So sorry for those still in pain.  My surgery was on the 29th and I am still in pain. Had 145 ccs drained from a seroma on Friday and am already feeling so full I will explode. I have been putting heat on my chest and wearing a compression/sports bra helps.  I have been weepy today when my kids aren't around. This just seems too hard. All of the chemo, now this, and I see the radiation Oncologist this coming Friday to discuss my rads schedule.
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2011 06:18PM ForMyBoys wrote: I'm still easily fatigued too, 2 1/2 weeks out from BMX w/no reconstruction. My cancer side is concave and much more sore than the other side. Have been aspirated 3 times, but it is going down each time. See the radiologist on Fri for rads consult. My BS said the fatigue is from a huge hormone change after surgery.
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2011 10:46AM ForMyBoys wrote: Hello ladies. I had neo-adjuvant chemo with a complete response by the time of my bi-lateral MX on March 29. Size of tumor and nearness to chest wall still recommends radiation. I have had my rads consult, but they have put me off until I can raise my arm above my head freely. The cancer side had many more issues after surgery and was told not to move my shoulders until my seromas subsided. I was cleared on Wed to start my exercises, so hopefully I will quickly be loose enough to start rads. I am to have 25 doses.  They do not want me using any cream at all unless I develop a problem and then they want me to only use what they prescribe...but I am not sure if I will comply with this. I am just now able to massage cream into my scars and it is helping my wounds heal and range of motion. I don't think I will stop..
Posts.Title: May 2011 Radiation Pinkprincess GabbyCal

Posts.Content: May 20, 2011 11:27PM ForMyBoys wrote: Radiation is still really hard on me emotionally too. I have only had 9 treatments so far, but I I am between pink and red. They said I would get red early b/c of the bolus. I've been tender since day 1, not it downright hurts.  I hope everyone has a wonderful rads--free weekend and does something to pamper themselves!!
Posts.Title: May 2011 Radiation Pinkprincess GabbyCal

Posts.Content: May 27, 2011 01:30AM ForMyBoys wrote: cb451--I've had several days of nauseau too.  I'm not supposed to hold my breath...I am supposed to breathe normally. I had bmx w/no reconstruction and they use a bolus every time. I wonder if that is the difference?
Posts.Title: May 2011 Radiation Pinkprincess GabbyCal

Posts.Content: May 21, 2011 06:04PM ForMyBoys wrote: brenilea-- I hope your pain eases soon. It is hard to look at. The whole ordeal is de-humanizing. Since my body seems so foreign to me, I have tried to focus on my soul and have been spending more time reading/praying. mamaoftwo--I had BMX and had complete pathological response to chemo. BUT, my tumor was originally 4.9 cm x 4.9 cm (7.5 including irregular margins) and was less than 1 cm from my chest wall. So the team highly recommended radiation. I went with it since I am only 46 and a single mom of 2 boys. They said my age was a factor in their recommendation. Another deciing factor for me was that if it came back, I coulnd't use much of the red devil again because of the lifetime limit.
Posts.Title: May 2011 Radiation Pinkprincess GabbyCal

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2011 06:13PM ForMyBoys wrote: Congrats to all who are finished!! I only had 3 left, but my skin was so far gone Monday they gave me this week off. They told me to expect it to get worse this week and it has. It is only under my arm. Turned cooked hamburger gray, then the blistering started. Where the cancer was is barely red. I am going to refuse the last 3. So I guess I am done too, but I don't really feel like celebrating. I had shingles during chemo and they wouldn't let me sit in the waiting rooms for fear I would contaminate other cancer patients with chicken pox. I even had to get my chemo in an isolation room.
Posts.Title: May 2011 Radiation Pinkprincess GabbyCal
